p: The production of egg-based influenza vaccines has remained virtually unchanged since the advent of split (subvirion) vaccines in the 1970s, and still commands 88% of the global market share in 2018 [ 19]. The main advantages of the egg-based platform include an excellent production capacity that is capable of producing an estimated 1.5 billion doses annually, and a low production cost that allows global access to the vaccine [ 20].
